title: Orders Without Friction
excerpt: Streamlining the booking experience while maximizing ancillary opportunities for airlines.
author: Anders Löfgren
content:
In today's competitive airline market, the booking experience can make or break a sale. Every click, every delay, every moment of confusion is sand in the gears of your revenue engine.

Customers don't abandon bookings because they changed their mind. They abandon because something got in the way.

The Real Cost of Friction

Every additional step, confusing option, or technical hiccup in the booking process increases the likelihood of cart abandonment. But let's put some numbers to it:

Industry Reality Check

Airlines lose an estimated $18 billion annually to booking abandonment. Even a 1% improvement in conversion can translate to millions in recovered revenue.

The Five Friction Killers

Through years of working with airlines, we've identified the most common friction points that silently kill conversions:

✗ Complex navigation and multi-step processes
✗ Unclear pricing and hidden fees
✗ Limited payment options
✗ Slow page loads and system timeouts
✗ Inflexible booking rules and restrictions

The Frictionless Approach

Creating a frictionless booking experience requires thinking holistically about the customer journey. Here's how leading airlines are doing it:

Simplify the Flow

Reduce steps. Use progressive disclosure. Show only what matters at each stage.

Transparent Pricing

Show all costs upfront. Surprise fees at checkout are conversion killers.

Smart Defaults

Use data to pre-select likely options, reducing decision fatigue.

Flexible Payments

Offer local payment methods. One size doesn't fit all markets.

The Revenue Paradox

Here's what many airlines get wrong: they assume reducing friction means reducing revenue opportunities. The opposite is true.

A streamlined experience doesn't sell less—it sells smarter.

When done right, a frictionless flow actually increases ancillary sales by:

✓ Presenting relevant offers at the right moment
✓ Making bundle deals intuitive to understand
✓ Using intelligent recommendations based on preferences

The Bottom Line

The goal is elegantly simple: make it as easy as possible for customers to give you their money.

Modern order management systems are designed to minimise friction while maximising both customer satisfaction and revenue. It's not a trade-off—it's a multiplier.
